definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]

sentences.english: He is ordering flags at all government buildings to be flown at half-staff in honor of the victims.
sentences.chinese: 他已下令所有政府大樓降半旗悼念遇難者。

sentences.english: Flags were at half mast everywhere on the day of mourning for victims of Wenchuan earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 例句汶川地震哀悼日全國降半旗誌哀。

sentences.english: He was forced to 8)abdicate and all over the country flags flew at 9)half-mast.
sentences.chinese: 他被迫讓位，爲此舉國降下半旗。

sentences.english: I also request the people of the United States to display the flag at half-staff from their homes for the customary forenoon period.
sentences.chinese: 我也要求美國人民在自己的住所依午前傳統降半旗。

sentences.english: HK to lower flag at half-mast to mourn victims.
sentences.chinese: 香港下半旗向在菲律賓受害者致哀。

sentences.english: I would suggest flying the flag at half-mast above Buckingham Palace, and coming down to London at the earliest opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 我建議在白金漢宮降半旗，你們也儘快回到倫敦。

sentences.english: National flags were lowered to half-mast in memory of this great man.
sentences.chinese: 國旗下半旗以紀念這位偉人。

sentences.english: Flags flew at half - mast upon the death of premier.
sentences.chinese: 總理逝世的時候降了半旗。

sentences.english: Following the  placement of the wreath, the marines will lower the flag to half staff.
sentences.chinese: 在敬獻花圈後，美國海軍陸戰隊員將降半旗誌哀。

sentences.english: Flags flew at half-mast upon the death of premier.
sentences.chinese: 國旗降半旗爲總理的死。

sentences.english: Today I go to school I saw the American flag is in the middle of the flagpole.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我看到了學校裏的美國國旗降了半旗。

sentences.english: On the anniversary of president Lincoln's assassination, flags are hung at half mast in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 在林肯總統被害的紀念日美國國內下半旗致哀。

sentences.english: In the UK, flags flew at half mast on government buildings and at Buckingham Palace.
sentences.chinese: 在英國，政府辦公樓和白金漢宮的國旗都降了半旗。

sentences.english: The department is also expected to lower its flag at Immigration Tower to half-mast today.
sentences.chinese: 入境處今日亦會下半旗致哀。

sentences.english: The flag ruffled in the breeze.
National flags flew at half-mast in public places, at Chinese embassies and at consulates.
sentences.chinese: 全國和駐外使領館下半旗誌哀。

definition: to pay respects to the dead/to mark sb's passing
to grieve over sb's death/to lament sb's death/mourning
to mourn/to pay last respects/mourning/memorial (service etc)
to observe a moment of silence in tribute
victim of an accident/casualty/martyr for one's country
to die in an accident/to die for a just cause
to participate in funeral procession/to attend a burial
